cons: - career path for employees are not very well defined, particularly for administrative personnel

pros: I find the pay to be quite good compared to similar jobs in the field.  There's quite a bit of flexibility in your work hours, if that is something you like to have.
cons: The atmosphere isn't the most inviting and there appears to be some cliques among the staff.  There has also been particular staff who have a reputation for being quite rude to other staff with no repercussions.  The paperwork is also quite overwhelming.

pros:
People served - youth who need support - gives them opportunity and another look at life
People you work with - for the most part, everyone is awesome, fun and feels like a family (but wait, there are cons too)
cons:
Compensation - SMART goals implemented, but means nothing for compensation
Executive team - be careful, they are smiles when you are in front of them, but wait, they will eat you up and spit you out

pros: Pay is decent, work with great people and get to contribute to an organization that is doing great things for families
cons: Some roles are poorly structured (3 in 1 job) and management knows this but has no interest in making changes. Some upper management are very unprofessional and harsh, love to belittle and bully.  Work environment is boring and work culture is non existent. Location isn’t the best.

review_title: Worked full time for a couple years there.
pros: Relaxing environment and good location. Not very busy, not much stress.
cons: Too much politics and inequality in salaries. Not much chance for promotion.
